sentence-with-footnote: "The MONA****** project is an interdisciplinary social/computer science effort which aims at producing a visual analytics suite for efficiently making sense of large amounts of activist events."
"We use the Nokogiri****** XML-parser to find time and meta tags in the HTML."

column5: we use AlchemyAPI’s****** author extraction service on the raw HTML to identify the article's author
column6: which enables us to attribute the extracted events."

sentence-with-footnote: "The article's text is split into sentences and words using Stanford’s sentence splitter and word tokenizer******."
"We complement Stanford’s named entity recognizer with TextRazor’s****** API to disambiguate found named entities to a single canonical entity in an external data source such as DBpedia."

column8: and disambiguation steps is stored in a Neo4j****** graph database."

sentence-with-footnote: "We have also used several existing Ruby gems for various supporting tasks: A Ruby wrapper****** for Stanford’s NLP tools
column7: and Neography for interacting with Neo4j."

sentence-with-footnote: "The majority of articles are from The New York Times****** (70%) and the Guardian (15%)
column5: the rest from similar news websites."
